title: Check Out Over 200 Nintendo Switch Game Deals For Black Friday
description: Nintendo Black Friday 2025 Game Sale Save up to 50% on Nintendo Switch exclusives. See at Walmart See at Amazon See at Best Buy See at Target With Walmart's Black Friday sale officially underway, Black Friday video game sales are running at all major retailers. Nintendo Switch and Switch 2 players already had a ton of great game deals to shop, but the promotions just keep getting better. We initially published this story last week with 85 Nintendo Switch game deals. After Amazon's sale started last Thursday, we expanded the list to 170 game deals. While the list hasn't doubled in size this time, our roundup now features over 200 game deals, including Switch exclusives for 50% off, and Switch 2 games for new all-time low prices. All Switch Game Deals: Walmart | Best Buy | Amazon | Target All Switch 2 Game Deals: Amazon | Walmart | Best Buy | Target Black Friday Deals on Nintendo Switch Exclusives If you're mainly interested in the official first-party game deals, we have a dedicated Nintendo Black Friday sale roundup that you should check out. Those deals have been selling out fast, but as of November 24 at 11 PM PT, Walmart has more games in stock and has more 50% discounts than other retailers. All nine games in the sale are $30 at Walmart. Target and Best Buy also each have a few of the $30 game deals. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Assassin's Creed Shadows Gets Free, Limited-Time Attack On Titan Quest
description: Anime is real in Assassin's Creed Shadows' version of feudal Japan, with the game's latest free title update introducing a quest based on Attack on Titan. Players only have a limited time to experience the eerie Crystal Cave and discover its secrets, however, as the AoT quest is only available from November 25 to December 22. The new mission brings protagonists Naoe and Yasuke to the mysterious Crystal Cave, where dark experiments threaten to unleash a new type of threat on feudal Japan. Explore the cave's depths and stop a mysterious cult from turning their kidnapped Titan-Shifter into a major problem. The new quest is available to all players who have unlocked Yasuke as a playable character, and can be unlocked by talking to quest-giver Ada in the Yamashiro region, North of Hanazo Tower. Players will be able to loot new cosmetics for their hideout throughout the quest, and will be rewarded upon completion with a new crystal katana for Naoe. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: SpongeBob Might Not Be The Only Paramount Cartoon Coming To Fortnite, Reports Suggest
description: When Fortnite dropped its Simpsons mini-season earlier this month, dataminers discovered evidence that a SpongeBob collaboration was also on the horizon. Now, reports suggest Fortnite's plans with Paramount go beyond just SpongeBob, with "many" other Paramount franchises lined up for the battle royale game. Alongside the Simpsons season launch on November 1, Epic introduced the new Sidekicks feature to Fortnite--small pet or minion creatures that follow players around. Regular Fortnite leaker SamLeakss has now reported that "many" Paramount-owned characters will soon be coming to the game as Sidekicks. There's no information yet on the characters or series that might be included, but Paramount has a huge roster of popular franchises, with its portfolio including both Nickelodeon and Comedy Central. Some of its biggest series include SpongeBob SquarePants, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Transformers, South Park, Dora the Explorer, and Paw Patrol--though it seems unlikely that the franchises aimed at younger kids will be added to a video game like Fortnite. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Pump.fun co-founder denies $436M cash out, claims it was ‘treasury management’
description: The Pump.fun co-founder disputed claims of a massive off-ramp and said Pump.fun’s USDC shifts were routine treasury operations.

title: Former Star Fox Dev Is Releasing A Spiritual Successor
description: It's coming up to a decade since Nintendo released Star Fox Zero for the Wii U in 2016. But if Nintendo won't get around to it, someone else has something very similar. Giles Goddard--one of the programmers of the original Star Fox--is working on Wild Blue Skies, a new on-rails sky shooter that looks and feels a lot like his former franchise. IGN debuted the new gameplay video for Wild Blue Skies, which covers the entirety of the second stage, Hurricane. It's enough to give you Star Fox 64 flashbacks as Bowie Stray, an anthropomorphic pilot dog, leads his squadron--Chuck, Roe, and Thorne--into battle during a raging storm. And it gives us enough of the new team's personalities that we can say Thorne is definitely the Slippy Toad of this group. Goddard and his team at Chuhai Labs keep up the banter between Bowie and his group throughout the stage. And when Boss--that is his name--shows up to fight them at the end of the level, even he gets in on the chatter. The final version of the game will feature multiple biomes for the team to fly over, and Bowie can already do a Fox McCloud-style barrel roll. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: The Silent Hill f Day One Edition Is $20 Off While Supplies Last
description: Silent Hill f Day One Edition (Amazon-Exclusive) $50 (was $70) See at Amazon Silent Hill f Standard Edition $50 (was $70) See at Best Buy The Silent Hill series saw its first all-new entry in the series earlier this year with Silent Hill f. The game expands the series' narrative scope with a new setting, new characters, and overhauled gameplay systems that make of one of the scariest games of the year. And while the game only recently launched back in late September, it's already on sale thanks to early Black Friday discounts at Amazon and Best Buy. You can pick up the Amazon-exclusive Silent Hill f Day One Edition for PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X for $50 (originally $70), which includes with a double-sided poster featuring art from the game and some digital bonuses. Meanwhile, at Best Buy, you can pick up the Silent Hill f standard edition, which is also down to $50 (was $70). Silent Hill f Day One Edition (Amazon-Exclusive) $50 (was $70) The Day One Edition is exclusive to Amazon and includes a physical poster and a handful of extra in-game items. The cover art also features an emblem in the upper left denoting it's the Day One Edition. Here's what you'll get: Silent Hill f base game A double-sided poster featuring protagonist Shimizu Hanako White Sailor School Uniform Peony Umamori Item Pack: Shriveled Abura-age, Divine Water, and First-aid Kit Amazon's deal applies to the PS5 and Xbox Series X versions of the game. See at Amazon Silent Hill f Standard Edition $50 (was $70) The Silent Hill f standard edition doesn't include the bonuses from the Day One Edition, but you're at least getting the full game at a $20 discount thanks to Best Buy's deal, which applies to both the PS5 and Xbox Series X physical versions. Since it's the same price as the Day One Edition, we recommend going for the standard edition only if the Day One Edition sells out at Amazon. See at Best Buy Silent Hill f captures the challenging, claustrophobic gameplay and dreary, macabre settings the series is known for, but moves the horror from the U.S. to Japan for the first time. With a new story, setting, and combat mechanics, Silent Hill f is both a good place to start if you're new to the series, and a benchmark moving forward, according to GameSpot's review by Jessica Cogswell. If you're looking for more survival horror deals, you can also grab the Silent Hill 2 Remake on PS5 for $30 (was $50) at both Amazon and Best Buy. Silent Hill titles are known for their deep exploration of human trauma fear, and Silent Hill 2 is the series' most apt example of this. As part of our best games of 2024 list, it expertly recaptured the original version's harrowing story, but with higher fidelity visuals, new voice acting, overhauled and expanded gameplay, and modern quality-of-life features. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Three Lego Star Wars UCS Sets Are Discounted In Walmart's Black Friday Sale
description: Lego Star Wars UCS Millennium Falcon $765 (was $850) | 7,541 Pieces See at Walmart Lego Star Wars UCS Jabba's Sail Barge $450 (was $500) | 3,942 Pieces See at Walmart Lego Star Wars UCS Jango Fett's Firespray-Class Starship $270 (was $300) | 2,970 Pieces See at Walmart Lego Star Wars collectors can secure rare discounts on three Ultimate Collector Series models during Walmart's Black Friday sale. The enormous and intricately designed UCS Millennium Falcon is discounted to $765 (was $850). The 7,541-piece display model is one of the five largest building sets by piece count in Lego history. You can also save $50 on Jabba's Sail Barge, the 3,943-piece replica of The Khetanna from Return of the Jedi. On the "budget" side of Lego Star War UCS is the 2,970-piece Jango Fett's Firespray-Class Starship, which released on Star Wars Day this year and is on sale for $270 (was $300). On the actual budget side of Star Wars Lego sets, Walmart's sale features several great smaller models for up to 50% off. The 654-piece Tantive IV Starship is up for grabs for only $40 (was $80). You could pair it with Boarding the Tantive IV, a Lego Star Wars diorama featured in Walmart's and Amazon's Black Friday Lego sale for $38.49 (was $55). Walmart is the only retailer outside of the Lego Store that sells the 630-piece Executor Super Star Destroyer, which is also discounted to $40 (was $70). See all Lego deals Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: The 5 Best Gaming Laptop Deals In Amazon's Black Friday 2025 Sale
description: Gaming Laptops on sale at Amazon Get a portable powerhouse in these early Black Friday deals See at Amazon Several early Black Friday deals are live, and if you're looking to upgrade to a gaming laptop, Amazon is offering steep discounts on models from top brands like Asus, MSI, and Acer. While there are dozens of great models listed, we've gone ahead and selected five of the best gaming laptop deals in Amazon's sale in case you're looking for recommendations on where to start. Some of the standout deals include the Asus ROG Strix G16 laptops. Amazon has two different configurations on sale, starting at $1,200 (was $1,500). The second model is on sale for and $1,424 (was $1,900). It has a Nebula Display with a 240Hz refresh rate. Both laptops are designed to make potential RAM and SSD upgrades simple with their easy-access shells. The MSI Katana can handle a wide variety of games using its Intel Core i9 processor, Nvidia GeForce RTX 5070 Laptop GPU, and 32GB of RAM. On sale for $1,370 (was $1,680), this is one of the powerhouse laptops on sale, and it features a rebuilt thermal system to help keep the hardware cooled during intense gaming sessions. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Get One Of 2025's Best Horror Games For As Low As $40
description: Cronos: The New Dawn (PS5) $40 (was $60) See at Amazon Cronos: The New Dawn (Switch 2) $45 (was $60) See at Amazon This year has been a strong one for survival horror games, and one of the highlights has been Cronos: The New Dawn, an original horror game from Bloober Team, the studio behind last year's critically acclaimed Silent Hill 2 remake. The sci-fi horror adventure launched just a few weeks ago back in September, but thanks to Amazon's Black Friday sale, you can grab Cronos: The New Dawn for up to 30% off. The discount varies between platforms--the PS5 version is just $40 (was $60), while the Switch 2 edition is discounted to $45 (was $60). This is the biggest price cut we've seen for the physical edition, but it will only be available for a limited time. Cronos: The New Dawn (PS5) $40 (was $60) Set in a futuristic rendition of Eastern Europe that has been radically altered due to a mysterious event, players step into the boots of the Traveler. Using time travel, the Traveler journeys back to 1980s Poland on behalf of a group known as The Collective to rescue key people before they die in the coming cataclysm. The Traveler has an arsenal of weapons to keep mutants at bay, but failing to dispose of their remains properly will result in surviving enemies fusing with the corpses to create a tougher and more dangerous creature. See at Amazon Cronos: The New Dawn (Switch 2) $45 (was $60) The Switch 2 version of Cronos: The New Dawn runs at a mostly stable 30fps. Some graphical concessions have been made, but the overall tone and atmosphere have been retained. This is a Game Key card version of the game, and it requires 25GB of storage space on the Switch 2. See at Amazon "While it doesn't achieve the incredible heights of the Silent Hill 2 remake, Cronos earns its own name in the genre with an intense sci-fi horror story that will do well to satisfy anyone's horror fix, provided they can stomach its sometimes brutal enemy encounters," Mark Delaney wrote in GameSpot's review, scoring the game 8/10. If you're looking for more early Black Friday video game deals, check out the links below to see all the discounts for PS5, Nintendo Switch, and Xbox Series X games available now. We've also compiled roundups for discounted Blu-rays, Lego sets, graphic novels, and more at GameSpot's Black Friday Deals Hub. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Get Sony's Belt Drive Turntable For Cheap During Black Friday
description: Sony PS-LX310BT Turntable $200 (was $450) See at Amazon See at Best Buy See at Sony Store Music streaming might be convenient, but it lacks the quality of physical media. You can find out for yourself just how good vinyl can sound in the modern era with this Black Friday deal on the Sony PS-LX310BT turntable, which is just $200 (normally $450) at Amazon, Best Buy, and the Sony store. This belt-driven turntable was introduced several years ago, and it blends classic audio technology with a few high-tech features, like Bluetooth connectivity. It's a great, user-friendly turntable choice, especially while it's nearly 60% off right now. Sony PS-LX310BT Turntable $200 (was $450) Designed to be a plug-and-play turntable, the PS-LX310BT is a user-friendly option for anyone looking to purchase their first device in this category. It has a fully automatic design and setting up the drive belt can easily be done in a few minutes. While the body is mostly plastic, the Sony turntable does have an aluminum die-cast platter and pipe tonearm. The included RCA cables let you plug it directly into a stereo system, but for wireless listening, you can connect Bluetooth-enabled devices like speakers and headphones. Other features include two speeds--33 1/3 rpm and 45 rpm--a built-in switchable phono/line-out phono preamp, three gain settings, a vibration-dampening slip mat, and a removable dust cover. See at Amazon See at Best Buy See at Sony Store Sony WH-1000XM5 Headphones $248 (was $400) Since you can connect a wireless headset to the turntable, we'd recommend grabbing one of Sony's popular noise-canceling headphones to go with this. Normally $400, the Sony WH-1000XM5 headphones are on sale for $248, and they come in four distinct colors. The big draw is the noise-canceling features, which use what Sony calls "Auto NC Optimizer" to automatically adjust the function based on your environment. The headphones also feature a lightweight design with soft leather, a battery life of up to 30 hours, and a selection of touch-control settings for media playback and communication. Black Midnight Blue Silver Smoky Pink See at Amazon We've also included several Bluetooth speakers below from Bose, Sony, and JBL that are on sale for Black Friday. While a stereo system is preferred for turntables, you can still get a high-quality audio experience from these devices, and their wireless nature helps reduce cable management. The other benefit is that this also makes it easier to transport your turntable to a function or a party, and there is a wide variety of speakers to choose from. JBL has pocket-friendly devices like the JBL Go, while Sony's range includes multi-function speakers with a similar design aesthetic to the turntable. Check out these and other audio gear deals in the list below. And once you've browsed those, head over to GameSpot's Black Friday Deals Hub for more of the latest discounts. More Black Friday Audio Gear Deals Bose Bose Soundlink+ -- $190 ($270) Bose Soundlink Micro -- $89 ($119) Bose Soundlink Flex -- $120 ($150) Bose Soundlink Revolve+ -- $180 ($300) Sony Sony SRS-XB100 -- 443 ($65) Sony SRS-XP700 Party Speaker -- $348 ($550) Sony ULT Field 5 Bluetooth Speaker -- $195 ($350) Sony HT-S2000 3.1 channel Dolby Atmos soundbar -- $298 ($500) JBL JBL Go 3 (Black) -- $30 ($40) JBL Go 3 (Blue) -- $30 ($40) JBL Xtreme 2 -- $150 ($200) JBL Extreme 3 -- $200 ($330) Amazon Black Friday Gaming Deals Check out all of the video game and hardware discounts. See at Amazon Sign up for GameSpot's Weekly Deals Newsletter: Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Suit Up For The Racetrack With These Mario Kart Racing Jackets
description: Mario Kart Canvas Racing Jacket Kids (Red) $50 See at Target Mario Kart Canvas Racing Jacket Kids (White) $50 See at Target Mario Kart Canvas Racing Jacket Adults (White) $70 See at Target Discounts on Blu-rays, video games, and TVs are par for the course during Black Friday, but Target is also offering some limited-edition fashion during this time of the year, including limited-edition Mart Kart Canvas Racing Jackers. These jackets look like authentic racing attire you'd seen worn by drivers and pit crew in real-world racing events, but they sport logos, emblems, and other details inspired by the Mario Kart series. The Jacket is available in red and white kid sizes for $50, or $70 for Adu for adult sizes. Mario Kart Canvas Racing Jacket Kids (Red) $50 The first jacket design in stock at Target is a bold red racing jacket. It has the Mario Kart logo embroidered on the right sleeve and on the shoulders, a fully embroidered back emblem celebrating the game's 1992 debut, and badges on the chest that pay tribute to the classic game. It's complemented by black and white accents, and this jacket is tailored for kids. See at Target Mario Kart Canvas Racing Jacket Kids (White) $50 The white canvas jacket is a vintage-inspired piece of clothing. Made from 100% cotton heavyweight canvas, it has the Mario Kart logo on the right sleeve and shoulders, black and red accents, and the back is full of adverts found in classic Mario Kart games. You'll find several in-game companies here, like Bowser Oil, Bob-Omb Plugs, and more. This jacket is also sized for kids. See at Target Mario Kart Canvas Racing Jacket Adults (White) $70 For grown-ups looking to wear Mario Kart-inspired clothing, the white canvas jacket is also available in general adult sizes. See at Target If you're looking for more gifts for the Nintendo fan in your life, you're in luck. Nintendo's official Black Friday deals are now live, with plenty of games, Amiibo figures, and other official merch on sale while supplies last. Switch and Switch 2 owners can check out our guide on a the over 150 games on sale, or check the links below for even more Nintendo Black Friday deals. And for deals on other video games, Blu-rays, collecitbles, and more, check out GameSpot's Black Friday Deals Hub. title: Even Charlie Cox thinks his Game Awards nomination for Expedition 33 is misplaced
description: While he's "thrilled" to be nominated, Cox deflected praise onto one of his Expedition 33 co-stars — something The Game Awards should do itself.

title: What it's like to work from home in Skyrim VR
description: YouTuber habie147 spent the day organizing spreadsheets, fielding calls, and fighting dragons in Skyrim VR

title: Steam Awards' GOTY nominations are live and really fun
description: You can vote for games you're bad at, and games with cool innovations, among other inventive categories for the Steam's 2025 awards

title: HBO Max Black Friday deal is a cheap way to watch Game of Thrones, DCU
description: Black Friday 2025's best streaming deal may be HBO Max's 70% off deal for 12 months.

title: How Pluribus pulled off its biggest stunt yet
description: Pluribus' Nito Larioza goes behind the scenes on episode 4, "Please, Carol. Here's why bird movement and "Think of chocolate" are his go-to tips.

title: Kirby Air Riders is the best multiplayer game of the fall
description: Kirby Air Riders' City Trial mode has enough hidden depth to make it a multiplayer obsession, even while games like Arc Raiders dominate the charts.

title: Republicans push Obamacare tax credit alternatives as enrollment deadline looms
description: Republicans are proposing alternatives to Obamacare enhanced tax credits, with the enrollment deadline just three weeks away.

title: Fortnite's "sweaty" problem could be its downfall
description: The Simpsons season has been plagued with complaints from players who are sick of losing, but don't want to play friendlier modes like Delulu

title: Assassin's Creed Shadows is getting an Attack on Titan crossover event
description: Ubisoft launches a surprise AC Shadows x Attack on Titan holiday event with free story content and exclusive items, available Nov 25 to Dec 22

title: Shoppers curtail Black Friday plans to stretch spending: ‘They are using every tool that they can,’ expert says
description: Amid concerns about the economy, persistent inflation and the latest wave of tariff hikes, shoppers plan to spend a little less this year.
